project.teaser: The main objective of REHOUSE is to develop and demonstrate 8 renovation packages of promising technology innovations until TRL7. The renovation packages are fully designed for a wide range of building renovation actions, including deep renovations, that overcome the main...
project.objective:
The main objective of REHOUSE is to develop and demonstrate 8 renovation packages of promising technology innovations until TRL7. The renovation packages are fully designed for a wide range of building renovation actions, including deep renovations, that overcome the main barriers that slow down the current EU renovation ratios, following circularity principles, including multi-functionality through active/passive elements integration, prefabrication and off-site construction of components and respect of buildings aesthetics, architectural and historic value. REHOUSE also implements an inclusive people-centric social engagement strategy to endow the renovation wave with a resident and owner perspective towards affordability, satisfaction and attractiveness of sustainable renovation.
The renovation packages will be deployed across 4 locations serving as demonstrators located in Greece, Italy, France and Hungary. These buildings renovations include detailed design, pilot set-up, demonstration and evaluation to validate in operational conditions (social) the prototypes of the 8 renovation packages.
REHOUSE proposes solutions that cover together a set of 5 renovation principles offering technically and economically affordable renovation solutions with enough flexibility to tackle almost 100 % of the building renovation challenges at EU level. The aim is to boost market uptake, scalability and replicability of REHOUSE renovation packages, linking its value proposition with critical economic, technical, social, regulatory and data security/protection aspects and barriers and propose practical recommendations on how to overcome them.
project.title: Renovation packagEs for HOlistic improvement of EU’s bUildingS Efficiency, maximizing RES generation and cost-effectiveness
project.keywords: sustainable materials, prefabrication, off-site construction, RES integrated, efficient HVAC, circularity, renovation packages, buildings, construction, BIM

article.title: Revolutionising building renovation across the EU

result.title: Detailed models of 8 renovation packages (BIM-based)
result.description: Report with the process of modelling with a common datamodel all details of the Renovation Packages to be usable in most simulation tools.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - REHOUSE (Renovation packagEs for HOlistic improvement of EU’s bUildingS Efficiency, maximizing RES generation and cost-effectiveness)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: The European Union's building sector, a significant consumer of energy and a major contributor to emissions, led to the European Commission launching a strategy in October 2020 titled "A Renovation Wave for Europe – Greening our buildings, creating jobs, improving lives."...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Design of social activities tailored to the local contexts
result.description: Report of tailored social activities that will be designed to contribute to the validation of the solutions proposed in REHOUSE renovation packages at TRL7.

result.title: REHOUSE set of indicators selected for the impact assessment
result.description: Report with the exhaustive description of the KPIs selected covering a holistic/multidimensional assessment of the renovation packages and building’s performance, addressing the whole renovation value chain

result.title: Technical and social innovation actions in social housing: a pilot case in the South of Italy

details.authors: M. Misceo, A. Amato, M. Diana, A. Di Micco, P. Sposato and S. Tamburrino

result.title: Digital products in REHOUSE RPs Repository (e.g. OptEEmAL rep.)
result.description: Report including the specifications of each renovation package to be included in the digital catalogue and the models of the Renovation Packages to be included in the most common rennovation planning tools.

result.title: Energies

details.authors: Dimitrios Vamvakas; Panagiotis Michailidis; Christos Korkas; Elias Kosmatopoulos

result.title: LEVEL(s)-based MEL framework for REHOUSE RPs and demos
result.description: Report with the inventory of existing Measurement, Evaluation and Learning technics. This inventory will complementing LEVEL(s). The specific KPIs will be included.

result.title: Guidelines for recycling the components of 8 renovation packages
result.description: Report with the recommendations (techniques, methods and processes) to drastically lower the environmental footprint of the renovation packages once these reach the end of their service life

result.title: Demosites implementation roadmaps and execution permits
result.description: Report with the details of the activities to be carried out before starting the physical works, including the execution plan, licences and permits of the 4 demos including a detailed breackdown of activities.

result.title: Digital Twins of the 4 buildings of the 4 demos
result.description: Report with the complete virtual models (BIM-based digital twin) of the eight renovation packages that will be developed in REHOUSE and for each building in each of the four demosites in which the renovation packages will be validated.

result.title: Guidelines for integrating the models in retrofitting design-tools
result.description: Report with the specification of the needs, parameters and description of the models for their potential inclusion in Simulation tools in order to be integrated on them so that can be used in simulations to evaluate their potencial performance.

result.title: Guidelines for installation of 8 renovation packages
result.description: Report that include the details (including the specifications) of the necessary steps to carry out the installation process (step by step) of the renovation packages in a diverse set of buildings, considering the different building typologies.

result.title: Guidelines for the manufacturing process of 8 renovation packages
result.description: Report with the specification of the fabrication/manufacturing process of the renovation packages, to support this manufacturing activity of the renovation packages will be included in this deliverable.

result.title: Taxonomy for Renovation Packages characterisation
result.description: Report with the taxonomy with the details about the categorisation of the different Renovation Packages in different application areas and with the corresponding co-benefits.

result.title: Social situation of the 4 local contexts
result.description: Report with the social baseline situation of the 4 demosites in terms of social innovation. Diagnosis of the current situation in the 4 different local contexts.

result.title: Monitoring programmes for the 4 demos [construction, building operation, LCA, LCC]
result.description: Report with the monitoring programmes/plans for the construction (retrofitting) phase and the operation phases of the buildings in the 4 demosites. A construction monitoring programme, a Building Operation monitoring programme, a LCA plan, LCC plan and S-LCA plan per each demosite will be included.

result.title: Report of the social innovation activities launched in the 4 demos
result.description: Report of the activities related to the preparation of the pilots and also about the social innovation activities developed in each demo with the support of the social task forces to secure the co-creation and co-design of the solutions.

result.title: Analysis of Social innovation activities for retrofitting projects
result.description: Report about the creation and activities of the social innovation task forces for each demo. Analyisis of the most applicable social innovation activities to each demosite.

result.title: Definition of the Long-term perf. tests of the components of the RPs
result.description: Report with the methodology to secure the long-term performance of the components of the renovation packages. The application of this methodology is reported in D2.4.

result.title: Tech. diagnosis (SRI, energy performance, air quality) initial status
result.description: Report with the SRI initial level, current Energy performance and thermal confort and air quality status for the buildings of the four demosites. This will be the baseline (initial status) of the demosites.

result.title: Energies

details.authors: Christos D. Korkas; Christos D. Tsaknakis; Athanasios Ch. Kapoutsis; Elias Kosmatopoulos

result.title: The Importance of Renovation and Renewable Energies for Carbon Neutral Building
Social Life Cycle Assessment Plan (S-LCA) for the 4 local contexts.
result.description: Report with the Social Life Cycle Assessment, (S-LCA) plan. This plan will complement the evaluation programme with the activities to assess the social aspects of the renovation packages.

result.title: Report of Social requirements identified in the elicitation activities.
result.description: Report of the requisites capturing activity that will be done collaboratively and iteratively in a co-creation process managed by the social task forces that are created for each demosite of the 4 participant cities.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
